content.en: Ultrasound blood flow: Scientists have been exploring various algorithms to improve the estimation of blood velocity and flow imaging in medical ultrasound. These algorithms, such as directional beamforming, synthetic aperture flow imaging, and speckle tracking, are being evaluated for their accuracy and efficiency in measuring blood flow. Additionally, new methods like ultrafast compound Doppler imaging and vector projectile imaging are being developed to provide faster and more detailed visualization of blood flow patterns. These advancements in algorithmic techniques aim to enhance the diagnosis and understanding of cardiovascular diseases.
content.da: Ultralyd blodstrøm: Forskere har undersøgt forskellige algoritmer for at forbedre estimeringen af blodets hastighed og strømningsafbildning i medicinsk ultralyd. Disse algoritmer, såsom retningsbestemt beamforming, syntetisk apertur flow imaging og speckle tracking, bliver evalueret for deres nøjagtighed og effektivitet i målingen af blodstrøm. Desuden bliver nye metoder som ultrahurtig compound Doppler imaging og vektorprojektilafbildning udviklet for at give hurtigere og mere detaljeret visualisering af blodstrømmønstre. Disse fremskridt inden for algoritmeteknikker har til formål at forbedre diagnose og forståelse af hjerte-kar-sygdomme.
